text: behold my servant shall act wisely he shall be high and lifted up and shall be exalted as many were astonished that you his appearance was so marred beyond human semblance and his form beyond that of children of mankind so shall he sprinkle many nations kings shall shut their mouths because of him for that which has not been told them they see that which they have not heard they understand who has believed what he has heard from us and to whom has the arm of the lord been revealed for he grew up before him like a young plant and like a rooigrond he had no former majesty that we should look at him and no beauty that we should desire him he was this spies and rejected by men a man of sorrows and acquainted with grief and as one from whom men hide their faces sees this spies and we esteem him not a god my god why have you forsaken me why are you so far from saving o my god i cry by day but you do not answer and by night but i find no rest surely he has borne our griefs and carried our sorrows yet we esteem him stricken smitten by god had flicked but i am a worm and not a man scorn by mankind and despised by the people all who see me mocked me they make bows at me they wagged their heads he trusted in the lord let him deliver him let him rest you him for he delights in him but he was pierced for our traces crushed
the path was the chastisement that brought us peace and with his wounds we are healed be not far from me

trouble is near and there is none that help many bulls in compass me strong bulls of bashan surround me they open their mouths at me like a ravening and roaring lion all we like sheep have gone astray we have turned every one to his own way and the lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all i am poor out like water and all of my bones are out of joint my strength is dried up like a potsherd and my tongue
tis too much as you lay me in the dust of death he was oppressed

he opened not his mouth like a lamb that is led to the slaughter and like a sheep that before it shears is silent so he opened not his mouth by oppression and judgment he was taken away and as for his generation who considered that he was cut off out of the land of the living stricken from the transgressions of my people and they made his grave with the wicked with a rich man in his death although he had done no violence and there was no deceit in his mouth for dogs and compassed me a company of evil doers and circles the pierced my hands among beat i can count all of my bones they stare and closed over me they divide my garments among them and for my clothing the cast lots yet it was the will of the lord to crush him he had put him to grief when his soul makes an offering for guilt he shall see his offer he shall prolong his days the will of the lord shall prosper in his hand out of the anguish of his soul he shall see and be satisfied by his knowledge shall the righteous room my servant make many to be accounted righteous and he show bear their iniquities therefore i will divide him a portion with the men he shall divide the spoil with the strong because he poured out his soul to death and was numbered with the transgressors yet he bore the sin of many and made intercession for the transgressors
